description.narrative: By end 2021, national, regional and local authorities have the necessary capacity to develop strategic and operational nutrition plans and strategies and to plan, budget and coordinate nutrition interventions utilizing a human-rights based approach, which contributes to Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2. By the end of 2021, adolescents, pregnant and breastfeeding women, mothers and children aged 0-5 years make greater use of quality nutritional services and adopt adequate nutrition and feeding practices in 15 provinces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Capacity building of 1,747 health professionals at different levels of the health system (central, regional and peripheral), joint missions, daily support by UNICEF programme managers and national and international consultants, have together resulted in the health system having a critical mass of human resources capable of planning and ensuring the management of nutritional programmes. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/02/2020
